de.pifpafpuf.web.urlparam

Class ParamManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.pifpafpuf.web.urlparam.ParamManager

  • public class ParamManager
extends Object
    helps to manage url query parameters by retrieving them from a request and by providing them again for a url.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParamManager(String requestUri)
      creates a manager for the given requestUri with an empty list of url parameters.
      ParamManager(String requestUri, ParamManager client)
      creates a manager for the given requestUri and a chained client.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      add the given value with the name specified by the template.
      <T> List<UrlParam<T>> addAll(UrlParam<T> template, String[] values)
      parses all parameters from the array given.
      String getNewUrl(UrlParam<?>... onlyParams)
      creates a URL containing only the explicitly provided parameters
      String getRequestUri() 
      String getUrl() 
      String getUrl(Set<UrlParam<?>> drop, List<UrlParam<?>> add)
      creates a URL from the requestUri specified in the constructor and the stored parameters minus the parameters of the drop list plus the parameters of the add list.
      String getUrl(UrlParam<?> drop, UrlParam<?> add)
      calls @{link #getUrl} with single element drop set and add list.
      String getUrlWith(UrlParam<?> add)
      calls @{link #getUrl(Set,List)} with empty drop set.
      String getUrlWithOut(UrlParam<?> drop)
      calls @{link #getUrl} with empty add list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParamManager

        public ParamManager(String requestUri)
        creates a manager for the given requestUri with an empty list of url parameters. Use the @{code addXX} methods to add parameters..
        Parameters:
        requestUri - is the URI used when creating URLs. In a servlet, request.getRequestURI() should typically be used

      • ParamManager

        public ParamManager(String requestUri,
            ParamManager client)
        creates a manager for the given requestUri and a chained client. The chained client is used in url generation to add its own URL parameters. The client's requestUri is not used.

    • Method Detail

      • getRequestUri

        public String getRequestUri()

      • add

        public <T> UrlParam<T> add(UrlParam<T> template,
                  String value)
        add the given value with the name specified by the template. The parameter is stored internally as well as returned. The template is used as-is, if the parameter is not specified or has the wrong format. In a Servlet, this method will usually be called like 
         add(template, request.getParameter(template.getName()))
        Parameters:
        value - for the templated parameter, encoded as a String or null.

      • addAll

        public <T> List<UrlParam<T>> addAll(UrlParam<T> template,
                           String[] values)
        parses all parameters from the array given. All which can be parsed are added to the result list. If the result list stays empty the template alone is put into the result list, given it has a non-@{code null} value. The result list is stored internally and is also returned. In a Servlet, this method will usually be called like 
        add(request.getParameterValues(template.getName()), template)
        Parameters:
        values - may be null

      • getUrl

        public String getUrl()

      • getUrlWith

        public String getUrlWith(UrlParam<?> add)
        calls @{link #getUrl(Set,List)} with empty drop set.

      • getUrlWithOut

        public String getUrlWithOut(UrlParam<?> drop)
        calls @{link #getUrl} with empty add list.

      • getUrl

        public String getUrl(UrlParam<?> drop,
            UrlParam<?> add)
        calls @{link #getUrl} with single element drop set and add list.

      • getUrl

        public String getUrl(Set<UrlParam<?>> drop,
            List<UrlParam<?>> add)
        creates a URL from the requestUri specified in the constructor and the stored parameters minus the parameters of the drop list plus the parameters of the add list.
        Parameters:
        drop - parameters to drop during URL generation
        add - parameters to add during URL generation
        Returns:
        the generated URL

      • getNewUrl

        public String getNewUrl(UrlParam<?>... onlyParams)
        creates a URL containing only the explicitly provided parameters
